channel.title: Jail Co-ords Help
channel.description: I am trying to set a custom jail.. but, in the area that I want to set the jail as the jail area, the doors don't open, and my coords command ::dataon only records the coordinates of where I am standing, it also records the mouse coords but they are only three digit coordinates and not four like the rest of them.. how do i get the coordinates of an area that I want to set as my jail if I cannot open the door and walk in..

item.title: Jail Co-ords Help
item.dc:creator: @Pkmasterpwnz Pkmasterpwnz
item.description:
@Pkmasterpwnz wrote:

thanks i got the coordinates, i teleported one more block and got what i needed thanks a million for the help.

Read full topic

item.title: Jail Co-ords Help
item.dc:creator: @T7S T7S
item.description:
@T7S wrote:

You’ll need the ::mypos command as it will tell you the co’ords of your current position.

You’ll also need the teleport command. (::tele)

If you’re making a custom jail, don’t forget to change the details within your source. I’m not sure what file this is in for you. My best guess would be config.java or client.java

Here’s the ::mypos command. You’ll most likely have the ::tele command.

if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("mypos") && c.playerRights >= 1) { c.sendMessage("X: "+c.absX+" Y: "+c.absY+" H: "+c.heightLevel); }

Read full topic

item.title: Jail Co-ords Help
item.dc:creator: @ohokay ohokay
item.description:
@ohokay wrote:

A working ::noclip, or simply ::tele X Y

If you’re trying to get past a door, just teleport one square, which will take you past the door

Read full topic
